result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Alejandro Reyes

records.addlTxt:
Defense counsel is in trial in another Court and unable to hear this case.  Defendant appeared by zoom.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Daniel Alejandro Reyes appeared by video.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz appeared by video for Daniel Alejandro Reyes.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests adjourned pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Daniel Alejandro Reyes in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer Garrett Olson (Greenfield PD). State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel Alejandro Reyes in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties do not contest the report.   Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed and reinstates the proceedings. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
REYES REPORT dated 7/6/2022, filed.
Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.

Defendant Daniel Alejandro Reyes in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for preliminary hearing. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Forensic evaluation will take place the Wisconsin Forensic Unit, Room 504 of the Safety Building with Dr. Goebel on 6/7/2022 at 12:00 pm. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prior: 4077 South 35th Street, #3, Greenfield, WI 53221
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defendant is in inpatient treatment. Defense requests an adjournment. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
22RM021262  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriff 04/15/2022
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ALR (dob 11/21/1999)

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 4 Supervision.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Daniel Alejandro Reyes in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
